body: English only. Your time is not accurate, what is the relationship with us?

> 
> 
> English only. Your time is not accurate, what is the relationship with us?


If time synchronization is not taken into account, service CPM statistics will exist a lot of errors.
Time sync is a very common issue in a distributed system. If you care time-related metric, you should set the sync.

@ygsama The traceid is available there, we are welcome contribution to provide span id API.

If set InstanceMethodsInterceptPoint is `org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer#actualInvokeListener ` will solve this. But it was only support `rabbit in spring boot` not native rabbit.
So what do you think ? @wu-sheng
Then we need another instrumentation to make the across threads work.
what do you think about  make a `spring rabbit plugin` as a optional plugin?

Optional plugin means
1. The plugin is only required in particular cases

Or

2. The plugin has performance concerns.

From the thing you post, look like this is a common spring for spring-rabbitmq-plugin. SkyWalking plugin is auto active, which means, when you don't active `org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer#actualInvokeListener` in your codes, it should stay cold.
The Gateway plugin for 2.1.x will be merged today, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/2517

What I want to achieve is to be able to screen the services I am interested in through the label selector, and show their topology, their tracing data (if any). This gives us the flexibility to present topological information at different scales. 
Have we implemented similar functionality on the backend? But I don't see it on the UI, right?
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9354727/58067783-45b67200-7bc1-11e9-997a-24acab2a8e06.png)

New topology verified locally.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/58073506-4eb13e80-7bd5-11e9-8648-8bde504d4a3e.png)

If you are talking about multiple service filter topology, then this is a much bigger feature enhanced than I expected. 

> Have we implemented similar functionality on the backend? But I don't see it on the UI, right?

Right now, we only have two kinds of topology query.
1. One service topology. One level dependency(direct parent and child)
1. Global topology including all services.

If you want to filter services based on backend query, then you need to change lots of things.

> I am going to provide this plugin

thanks for your help

@wu-sheng is this check netty's license failed ?
I have a little concern about the 2.x netty version. Right now, if you check our dist tar, there are 4.1.27 netty jar(s) there.

Yes, I also think it's a Big Job. But I think it's a very meaningful thing. 
My initial point of departure was to provide subviews to users through this feature, because more users only care about the services they deploy and use. We can tag the services with user attributes and use them for filtering.
However, I find that if we implement this feature, our queries will become more flexible and easier to integrate with other systems. 
I hope that I can try not to change the original thing, only to achieve this through extension.
Looking forward to your Suggestions!

> However, I find that if we implement this feature, our queries will become more flexible and easier to integrate with other systems.

Yes. But meanwhile, we have to face the performance concerns. The reason why we design the query API in the current way, is making sure the query latency measurable. 

> I hope that I can try not to change the original thing, only to achieve this through extension.
Looking forward to your Suggestions!

There are two major challenges
1. How to query metadata. Service is an atomic object but based on instance register. So how do you plan to make tag exists in service level. And how do you make sure it is reasonable.
1. Query topology based on each service, and merged them on UI. If the performance is acceptable. The master branch UI topology is just changed. It supports query topology(one depth level) when you choose one at the left.

> I have a little concern about the 2.x netty version. Right now, if you check our dist tar, there are 4.1.27 netty jar(s) there.

there's not enough jars from the oap-libs of dist tar. we need provide version of 4.1.32.Final ? or i have a try to change the version of etcd4j
We provide because grpc needs that. And our tar is not small, over 100m. Cluster management usually includes a lot of dependency libs. So, I want to make sure don't add many news.

You need to learn.
1. New Receiver, like existing receivers.
1. OAL extension, like all existing scope objects.
1. GraphQL query extension.
1. UI extension.

We are an APM tool, so there is no as easy as `config and go`. We always need to understand the data relationship. 
I highly recommend you to read the concept introduction, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/README.md

@wu-sheng @zhaoyuguang 
I found that our spring cloud gateway 2.1.x plugin is named `gateway-2.x-plugin`. 
Is there any ambiguity here? 
Should we use `2.1.x` instead of `2.x` ?

@wu-sheng 
We encountered the same problem with Skywalking 6.1.0.
We run elasticsearch and Skywalking oap collector separately. And the skywalking agent run in container in k8s. we can get the point data while no service data. 
The issues in the below urls still exist for us.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2475
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2704
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2476
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2224

No one delete the data of elasticsearch manually.
All issues you list except for this, have been explained.  Including time zone and data delete issue. They are very clear if you have read the codes.
Because you need to agent toolkit activation to support. We don't support async append, you need to build a new activation to do that
I am waiting @zhaoyuguang to make the decision. How does he want to put the new plugin of 2.0.x
I will try to finish it in next milestone, if you have interests, contributions are welcome @SataQiu. Because I think `2.0.x`  can be finished  in 2.x, so I named it.

> Because I think 2.0.x can be finished in 2.x, so I named it.

Make sense. Rename it if necessary, such as 2.0.x is very incompatible with 2.1.x, like using a totally different way to intercept.

> > Because I think 2.0.x can be finished in 2.x, so I named it.
> 
> Make sense. Rename it if necessary, such as 2.0.x is very incompatible with 2.1.x, like using a totally different way to intercept.
